citation.article-title: Phylogenetic taxonomy of the family Chlorobiaceae on the basis of 16S rRNA and fmo (Fenna-Matthews-Olson protein) gene sequences.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: The species description is as given by Gorlenko (2001).
The GenBank/EMBL accession number for the 16S rDNA sequence of the type strain is Y07837.

The strain known as Prosthecochloris aestuarii 2K is genetically different from the type strain of Prosthecochloris aestuarii, to a degree that indicates species differentiation (97·3 % 16S rDNA sequence similarity and significant differences in sequence signatures).
It should be classified as a novel species of the genus Prosthecochloris.
However, as no pure culture is presently available, this description is postponed.
